citation.article-title: Sulfurihydrogenibium rodmanii sp. nov., a sulfur-oxidizing chemolithoautotroph from the Uzon Caldera, Kamchatka Peninsula, Russia, and emended description of the genus Sulfurihydrogenibium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Sulfurihydrogenibium
Straight to oval rods (1–3×0.3–0.7 μm), motile with single or multiple polar flagella.
NaCl not absolutely required for growth.
Able to utilize sulfur and thiosulfate as electron donors and molecular oxygen as the electron acceptor.
Some species can use a wide range of other electron donors and acceptors.
The G+C content of genomic DNA is between 28 and 35 mol%.
Most closely related to the genera Persephonella and Hydrogenothermus, on the basis of 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis.
Occurs in terrestrial and subterranean geothermally heated freshwater systems.
The type species is Sulfurihydrogenibium subterraneum.
